intro: Staphidiastrum coriaceum, commonly known as the roughleaf staphidium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its woody stems and broad, leathery leaves that are often covered in a rough, textured surface. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. The leaves and stems are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties.
